# pow(bases:exponents:result:)

**Type Method**

Calculates each single-precision element in the bases vector, raised to the power of the corresponding element in the exponents vector.

## Declaration

```swift
static func pow<T, U, V>(bases: T, exponents: U, result: inout V) where T : AccelerateBuffer, U : AccelerateBuffer, V : AccelerateMutableBuffer, T.Element == Float, U.Element == Float, V.Element == Float
```

## Array-Oriented Power Functions

- **pow(bases:exponents:)**: Returns each double-precision element in the bases vector, raised to the power of the corresponding element in the exponents vector.
- **pow(bases:exponents:)**: Returns each single-precision element in the bases vector, raised to the power of the corresponding element in the exponents vector.
- **pow(bases:exponents:result:)**: Calculates each double-precision element in the bases vector, raised to the power of the corresponding element in the exponents vector.
- **vvpow(_:_:_:_:)**: Raises each element in an array to the power of the corresponding element in a second array of double-precision values.
- **vvpowf(_:_:_:_:)**: Raises each element in an array to the power of the corresponding element in a second array of single-precision values.
